As though they would have ordered an end to foot traffic on the staircase during the night and then given their wrecking crew the morning off till check-out time. They did allow $20.00 off the room rate. Still, this time there really won't be a next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great spot if you like mexican food and Margarita's, and really, who doesn't!”
Reviews.Author: Style72
Reviews.Content: A great chilled spot in Old Town, it has a much better vibe than downtown. I could literally throw a rock at a handful of very good restaurants. You don't need a car, with the trolley being a few blocks away, but if you have one, they don't charge you for parking. We walked in and out of the restaurant, didn't seem like what we were looking for. Pool was nice and having laundry onsite was a bonus as well. There are plenty of spots throughout the property to sit and have an evening in with a bottle of wine as well, although we didn't. Overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: macman2
Reviews.Content: Sitting on 5 acres of land over Old Town, San Diego this hotel is a short walk into town and very convenient. The hotel sits on several layers on a hill and the rooms are large, with heavy tile floors, microwave, refrigerator, TV, etc. We found the rooms were clean. One disappointment was that wireless internet was only in certain designated outdoor areas and lobby which meant that you had to sit outside to get on the internet. Not bad usually, but could be a problem in bad weather. The grounds are lovely, landscaped and with flowers, but we were more impressed with our ability to walk into town which has a lively nightlife. The pool is ok and there is a heated spa pool. Parking is free and in a gated garage. We found the place charming and a ten minute drive into downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: maurice1123
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Very picturesque, gives you the feeling of visiting Mexico. Very good layout, if possible try to book a room above the swimming pool. Very nice rooms, pleasant and courteous staff. Located in the Old Town, walking distance to all the tours. Would recommend this hotel when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on outside, not so good inside”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel on the outside. But just like a book, don't judge it by its cover! First off, there was a LONG line at the lobby guest counter with about TEN groups of people waiting as THREE different hotel workers slowly gave out keys to rooms and took credit cards. VERY slow service. The parking situation is cumbersome. It is not gated (no guards) and like the person who wrote about their car being broken into, I sensed some suspicious characters who were watching guests as they checked in and hovering around the exterior of the hotel parking structures. The garage that is shared with the Acapulco restaurant is dark and not well lit and there are many "hidden" spots that seem unsafe. They should put video cameras down there or possible have guards roaming the parking lots, and install better lighting. As for the room, a "superior" queen: it was VERY noisy and the decor was something from 20 years ago (read: maroon and turquoise bed spread circa 1982 which totally clashed with the faux Spanish wood finishing in the room circa 1978). Old noisy wall-mounted air-conditioning unit. Could hear the person upstairs stomping around like Godzilla. Paper-thin walls. San Diego airport airplanes can also be heard landing. Room was near outside pool area, also very noisy. Bed was hard as a rock. Room was so-so on the cleaniless (could be cleaner). Didn't swim in the pool or spa, noting the crowdedness and cloudy water in the jacuzzi. For the amount of money ($200 with tax) you are getting what should be a $54 room at a cheapie roadside motel. For the price, the rooms should be MUCH nicer. It's too bad because the location is very convenient (Old Town is great) and the outside of the hotel and the hotel lobby are gorgeous (boganvilla, fountains, Spanish tiles, etc). Rating: B- or C+ What the room should cost: $50 per night What it does cost: $200 What they should do about it: redecorate/remodel rooms, put in better mattresses and nice bedding, insulate the building better, hire more security (or install video cameras). Add small guest touches that feel more hospitable. Kind of a "cold" feeling to the place as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: p-m1
Reviews.Content: We have visited San Diego many times in the past and, for our most recent visit, we decided to stay in the Old Town. First things first, what a great location! I would strongly recommend Old Town as "the" place to stay in San Diego. Lot's of atmosphere and things to do on the door step without the need for either car or taxi. It is a totally different experience and I would not hesitate recommending it. The only downside is the availability of hotels in this location. If you prefer top-end 4-5* then Old Town is probably not for you. As far as we could see there were 3 alternatives, Marriott Courtyard, Holiday Inn Express and the Hacienda (Best Western). Following the recommendations upon this site, we opted for the Courtyard which was a disappointment. The rooms were old/jaded, the operation franchised (ie. not Marriott) and it probably had the worst location of the 3 hotels. Although, we experienced no problems, it was dark walking back to the hotel at night and we had to keep looking over our shoulder! Our room also had a beautiful view of the I-5 in all its 8 lane glory with a large Lockheed factory as a backdrop! On our first night, we were walking into the Old Town when we saw the Hacienda on the side of a hill overlooking all the attractions etc. It had been built in a traditional style and looked beautiful with all its decorative lights off-setting the dark night sky. Remembering that we had researched this using Trip Advisor, we decided to take a closer look. We met the manager (Douglas) and explained our situation. He was very courteous and showed us a typical room at The Hacienda. The bottom line is that we decided to cut short our stay at the Courtyard and moved to the Hacienda for the next 3 nights. This was a good decision and we thoroughly enjoyed the remainder of our stay in Old Town. In comparison to The Courtyard, the Hacienda had the following advantages:- - traditional room, themed in the Old Town style. - great sunset views from our balacony across to Mission Bay. - nice Mexican themed restaurant. - great location - right in the thick of things with a short and safe walk home. - quiet location with little noise - US$30 per night saving over the Coutyard best rate for the same night. - free parking in a large garage (another US$15 saving in comparison to the Coutyard). - Our daughter also enjoyed the pool. If you are staying in Old Town, our advice would certainly be to stay at the Hacienda.

Reviews.Title: “Need a lesson in customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visiting from Australia, I booked 2 "Superior two queen" rooms through Hotels[--]. We had started the day at Legoland and planned on returning there later in the day, after checking into the hotel. On arrival to the rooms, I found that they had given us 2 single queen + sofa pullout-this of course was not going to be suitable, nor was it what was reserved and paid for. I went down to the reception desk to question this. The staff checked the booking, they checked their paperwork which stated the same as mine, they handed the problem onto some mysterious man behind shutters to "sort out". After a half hour or so, I enquired as to the progress, to be informed that they were trying to "rearrange rooming so that we could have the rooms ordered." After a further half hour, I was told that they were trying to get two rooms together. Finally after a total of an hour and 15 minutes, (in which time I was never even offered a cup of tea whilst waiting)I was informed that they don't have any superior 2 queen rooms available. The duty manager (I assumed as he never identified himself or position) informed me that it had been Hotels[--]'s fault. My friend took exception to him blaming Hotels[--], the duty manager kept his cool but basically ignored her after that. He not only blamed Hotels[--] but also insinuated that he wasn't getting paid for the room (and gave the impression that he didn't feel the need to worry about us due to the fact that we booked through this method)He offered a roll away bed-which of course was going to make the room even more cluttered than it would already be with the pull out sofa. As it was the Fourth of July weekend, we had no other choice than to stay here. I was not impressed with his customer service or business behaviour in blamming someone else for the problem. I rang Hotels[--] who were great in supporting my grievance and rebated a portion of the payment for the lower quality room supplied. Due to the time it took for them to "sort out the situation", it was too late in the day to travel back out to Legoland, so they not only ruined the adults fun getaway, but ruined the kids experience as well as they were looking forward to hvaing more fun. I travel quite a bit throughout Australia and stay at many different star rating hotels. I must say that I have received better customer service at lower rated hotels. There is only a coffee making machine in the hotel-not good if you want a cup of tea. No fresh milk supplied, no jug of cold water in the fridge, and no instructions on how to use the combined shower/bath combination spout-just work it out by trial and error. There were empty light sockets, missing globes.The room had a queen bed and pull out sofa-how many pillows? 2 and one in the drawer. The roll away bed came to the room without a pillow. Yes, I could have called and asked for more, BUT usually one would expect a pillow with a roll away bed, and they had left such a nasty impression that I didn't wish to talk to them again. The laughable thing was- on the phone a "message waiting" light was on-pick it up and you hear a spiel about how customer service and satisfaction are their main objectives-they should maybe spend some time on finding out the definition first!

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: mari777
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at the Hacienda when visiting San Diego, which is about 3-4 times a year. The location is outstanding and service is wonderful. Easy access to all attractions and best of all you are in heart of old town. Too many margaritas? Not to worry when you can walk to your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Super spot in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: tnsc
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hacienda is on a hillside in the center of San Diego's Old Town. Tourist central -- but delightful nonetheless. Rooms are roomy and comfortable, located in eight buildings at different levels on the hillside. While there is a perfectly good Mexican restaurant in the hotel (The Acapulco) with a terrific view towards Old Town and the harbor, there are something like 40 restaurants within walking distance. Most are Mexican, but there's also French, New Orleans/Cajun, Italian, and other cuisines very close by. The hotel is close to the airport, has free broadband wi-fi hotspots -- and free ethernet broadband in Building #8 -- and is a short walk from a trolley stop. Of course everyone in San Diego drives -- but the hotel's proximity to the freeways is just fine. The staff are helpful with good advice on virtually everything. The Hacienda is good for business travelers, as well as families, couples, and singles wanting to enjoy the delights of this beautiful city by the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Fountains, flowers, great location but a terrible mattress.”
Reviews.Author: Linzan
Reviews.Content: Hacienda has a beautiful setting with fountains, tiled steps, flowers. Hard to believe this is a motel. Open the door to your room, now you know it is motel. Rooms were probably upgraded last time in the 60's and show it. NIce to have microwave and refrigerator and the location is great. This is not really a hotel, just a motel with some extra amenities. The mattress was deplorable and noise from other guests on the weekends partying in the courtyard and the pool was disturbing but ended around 11:30. In general, I recommend it aobve the other Old Town locations if you can overlook that it is a little rundown and don't expect it to be a HOTEL.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Hacienda Hotel Old Town
HotelInfo.Address: 4041 Harney St, San Diego, CA 92110
